sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Industrial Goods Companies: Freightos Limited (CRGO) and Babcock & Wilcox Company (BW)
feed.summary: Analysts from Craig-Hallum have issued bullish sentiments on Freightos Limited (CRGO) and Babcock & Wilcox Company (BW) within the Industrial Goods sector. George Sutton maintained a Buy rating for Freightos, while Aaron Spychalla also maintained a Buy rating for Babcock & Wilcox, with a price target indicating a significant upside. Both companies currently hold a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Industrial Goods Companies: Freightos Limited (CRGO) and Babcock & Wilcox Company (BW)
feed.summary: Analysts from Craig-Hallum have issued bullish sentiments on two industrial goods companies: Freightos Limited (CRGO) and Babcock & Wilcox Company (BW). George Sutton maintained a Buy rating on Freightos, while Aaron Spychalla maintained a Buy rating on Babcock & Wilcox, with a price target suggesting a significant upside.

feed.title: Freightos founder Schreiber to step down as chief executive
feed.summary: Zvi Schreiber, founder of global freight booking platform Freightos, will step down as chief executive at the end of January to pursue other entrepreneurial interests. CFO Pablo Pinillos will serve as interim CEO while Schreiber transitions to a non-executive board member role. The company will focus on scaling the business and operational improvements, continuing to see airlines like SriLankan Cargo and Garuda Indonesia Cargo utilize its WebCargo booking platform.

feed.title: Freightos (NASDAQ:CRGO) Shares Down 0.3% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Freightos (NASDAQ:CRGO) shares experienced a 0.3% dip on Tuesday, trading at $3.06 with lower-than-average volume. The company faces weak fundamentals, including missed EPS estimates and a negative net margin, leading to a consensus "Sell" rating from brokerages. Institutional investors have, however, made some changes to their positions in the company's stock.

feed.title: Freightos CEO to step down as founder transitions to board role
feed.summary: Freightos Limited announced that founder and CEO Zvi Schreiber will step down on January 31, 2026, transitioning to a non-executive board member role. CFO Pablo Pinillos has been appointed Interim CEO while the company searches for a permanent replacement. Freightos (NASDAQ:CRGO) has seen strong business momentum, including new agreements and expansion into ocean freight, with its stock rising over 38% in the past six months and a recent 24% increase in Q3 2025 revenue.

feed.title: With A 27% Price Drop For Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) You'll Still Get What You Pay For
feed.summary: Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) has experienced a significant 27% price drop recently, yet its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 5.4x remains considerably higher than the industry average of 0.7x. This high P/S ratio is largely driven by strong historical revenue growth of 28% last year and a forecasted annual revenue growth of 25% over the next three years, substantially outperforming the Logistics industry's predicted 6.7% growth. Despite the recent share decline, the company's valuation reflects investor confidence in its future revenue prospects, making it a compelling case for further investigation into its underlying fundamentals.

feed.title: With A 27% Price Drop For Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) You'll Still Get What You Pay For
feed.summary: Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) shares recently dropped 27%, though they are still up 52% over the last year. Despite a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 5.4x compared to the industry average, the company's strong revenue growth of 28% last year and projected 25% annual growth for the next three years—significantly exceeding the industry's 6.7% forecast—justifies its premium valuation. Investors appear confident in Freightos's future prospects, keeping its P/S ratio elevated.

feed.title: With A 27% Price Drop For Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) You'll Still Get What You Pay For
feed.summary: Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) has seen a 27% stock price drop this month, yet its shares are up 52% over the past year. Despite a high 5.4x price-to-sales (P/S) ratio compared to its industry, analysts anticipate strong revenue growth of 25% annually for Freightos over the next three years, significantly outperforming the industry's projected 6.7% growth, which justifies its higher valuation.

feed.title: Multimodal digitalisation gathers pace beyond airfreight
feed.summary: Freightos is expanding its digital infrastructure beyond airfreight to encompass ocean and ground transport, aiming to create a unified platform for forwarders and shippers. This move includes increased API connectivity, real-time updates, and tools for predictive disruption management. The shift emphasizes proactive control over logistics operations as the industry moves towards a more integrated and efficient digital ecosystem.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Freightos Q3 2025 sees revenue climb 24%
feed.summary: Freightos Ltd. (NASDAQ: CRGO) reported a significant 24% year-over-year revenue increase to $7.7 million in Q3 2025, with gross margin improving to 69.1%. Despite this growth and processing a record 429,000 transactions, the stock experienced a decline of 4.75% after the earnings call. The company aims for adjusted EBITDA break-even by Q4 2026, driven by continued growth in transactions and strategic initiatives like the partnership with Visa and expansion into multimodal ocean solutions.

feed.title: Freightos shares rise over 2% as revenue jumps 24% on digital freight booking growth
feed.summary: Freightos Limited (NASDAQ:CRGO) reported a 24% year-over-year increase in third-quarter revenue, reaching $7.7 million, driven by the growing adoption of its digital freight booking platform. The company's shares rose over 2% in pre-market trading following the news, as transactions and Gross Booking Value also saw significant growth. Freightos anticipates continued growth in transactions and revenue for the fourth quarter.

feed.title: Nippon Express Expands Global Freight Operations with Freightos' Air and Ocean Pricing and Booking SaaS Solution
feed.summary: Nippon Express (NX Group) has announced its adoption of Freightos' multimodal freight pricing and booking Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution to enhance its global operations. This expansion builds on Nippon Express's existing use of WebCargo by Freightos for air bookings and will now include ocean and other transport modes across its network in 57 countries. The integration aims to provide faster and more efficient quoting and booking capabilities, leveraging Freightos' platform which handles over 1.5 million bookings annually, to navigate volatile logistics markets and deliver better service to customers.

feed.title: Garuda Indonesia Cargo joins WebCargo by Freightos
feed.summary: Garuda Indonesia Cargo has partnered with WebCargo by Freightos, enabling freight forwarders to access real-time digital eBooking for air cargo capacity. This collaboration offers exclusive access to Garuda Indonesia's key Southeast Asia trade lanes, including flights from Jakarta and Denpasar to major international cities. The integration aims to enhance visibility and efficiency for forwarders while strengthening Garuda Indonesia's cargo performance through a seamless online booking experience.

feed.title: Freightos Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: Freightos Limited reported strong second-quarter 2025 results, with revenue increasing 31% year-over-year to $7.4 million, exceeding management expectations. The company also announced an updated full-year outlook with increased transaction forecasts and tightened financial metrics ranges, reflecting confidence in sustained growth and strategic adaptability amidst global trade uncertainty. Freightos achieved a record 397 thousand transactions and significant growth in Gross Booking Value, demonstrating its solid position in the digital transformation of the international freight industry.

feed.title: Freightos Expands Board of Directors, Adding Rotem Hershko and Appointing Udo Lange as Chairman
feed.summary: Freightos (NASDAQ: CRGO) announced the expansion of its Board of Directors with the appointment of Udo Lange as Non-Executive Chairman and Rotem Hershko as a Director, both effective July 28, 2025. Lange, CEO of Stolt-Nielsen, has been a Freightos board member since 2019, while Hershko brings extensive platform and logistics expertise from leadership roles at Maersk and Amazon. These appointments aim to strengthen Freightos' vision for end-to-end global freight digitization and scale its digital platform.

feed.title: Freightos Reports Third Quarter 2024 Results: Revenue Up 21%, Record Since Going Public
feed.summary: Freightos Limited reported strong third-quarter 2024 financial results, with revenue increasing by 21% to $6.2 million, a record since going public. The company also saw significant growth in transactions and Gross Booking Value, and updated its full-year revenue and Adjusted EBITDA guidance upwards. These results were driven by the successful integration of Shipsta and expanding network of users, underscoring the company's progress towards profitability.

feed.title: Pacific Air Cargo joins Freightos’ Platform
feed.summary: Pacific Air Cargo has joined Freightos' WebCargo platform, expanding WebCargo's capacity to include key routes from Los Angeles to Hawaii and the Pacific Islands. This partnership enhances digital booking solutions and aims to streamline booking processes while offering enhanced visibility and efficiency for freight forwarders and shippers.

feed.title: Freightos Acquires Shipsta, Expanding Comprehensive Digital Freight Procurement Solution
feed.summary: Freightos has acquired Shipsta, a leading freight-tender procurement platform, to broaden its digital freight-booking capabilities and enhance its comprehensive digital freight procurement solution. This strategic acquisition aims to accelerate Freightos' revenue growth and achieve positive Adjusted EBITDA by the end of 2026, leveraging Shipsta's tender management and contract procurement services. The combined offering will provide a unified digital platform across air, ocean, road, and rail freight procurement.

feed.title: Webcargo by Freightos and Breeze integrate to offer instant cargo insurance quotes
feed.summary: Webcargo by Freightos and Breeze have integrated to allow freight forwarders to instantly price and purchase cargo insurance directly on the WebCargo platform. This partnership aims to streamline the insurance process, reduce policy costs and booking times, and address the issue of un- or under-insured global cargo, initially for forwarders in the US and UK. Both companies emphasize using data and technology to make international shipping faster, more cost-effective, and reliable.

feed.title: Coyne first carrier to offer DG bookings on WebCargo by Freightos
feed.summary: WebCargo by Freightos has partnered with Coyne Airways, making Coyne the first carrier to offer dangerous goods (DG) bookings on WebCargo's platform. This collaboration expands digital air capacity access to Africa, the Gulf, and Caspian regions, providing real-time rates and booking solutions. The partnership aims to streamline logistics and enhance customer experience for forwarders globally.

feed.title: Shipping Platform Freightos Slices Cargo Growth Forecast
feed.summary: Freightos, an online freight booking platform, has significantly lowered its 2023 revenue growth forecast from 87% to a range of 15% to 21%. This reduction comes as a direct result of slowing cargo volumes and declining freight rates, impacting the company in its first financial report since going public earlier this year. The Israel-based company, which benefited from pandemic-driven logistics issues, is now adjusting to a changed market.

feed.title: CRGO Stock Price and Chart — NASDAQ:CRGO
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed financial overview of Freightos Limited (CRGO) stock, including its current price, historical performance, key financial metrics, and analyst ratings. It also offers information about the company's operations, employee statistics, upcoming earnings, and answers frequently asked questions regarding its stock.

feed.title: Israeli online freight booking platform axes 13% of its workforce
feed.summary: Freightos, a Jerusalem-based online freight booking and payment platform, is laying off 50 employees, or 13% of its workforce, due to a slump in global shipping markets and persistent global headwinds. This workforce reduction is part of a cost-saving and operational efficiency plan aimed at achieving profitability with existing cash reserves without needing to raise more capital. The company, which went public on Nasdaq earlier this year, has seen its stock plunge by about 63% since its IPO amidst a global economic slowdown affecting freight markets.

feed.title: Freightos Terminal goes live
feed.summary: Freightos has launched Freightos Terminal, a new dashboard providing comprehensive market data and insights for global shipping. This platform integrates the Freightos Baltic Index and Freightos Air Index, offering real-time data, transit times, rate benchmarking, and expert analysis to enhance supply chain agility and cost-effectiveness. The release follows Freightos' recent merger with Gesher and its public listing on Nasdaq, with capital aimed at scaling the business and further developing its technology.

feed.title: Freightos lists on Nasdaq via SPAC merger at a $500 million post money valuation
feed.summary: Freightos, an Israeli freight booking and payment platform, has listed on Nasdaq through a SPAC merger with Gesher at a $500 million valuation. The company raised over $80 million in capital, including significant investments from Qatar Airways and M&G Investments, to further scale its business and enhance its technology. This public listing aims to fuel Freightos' efforts to expand its platform and improve its leadership position in the digital freight industry.

feed.title: Freightos, a Leading, Vendor-Neutral Booking and Payment Platform for International Freight, Lists on Nasdaq
feed.summary: Freightos, a global freight booking and payment platform, has listed on Nasdaq under the ticker symbols "CRGO" and "CRGOW" following its business combination with Gesher I Acquisition Corp. The company raised over $80 million to fund its growth strategy, aiming to scale its booking and payment platform and enhance its leadership in digitizing the international freight industry. Freightos aims to bring efficiency and transparency to the largely offline international freight industry, having facilitated nearly 700,000 digital booking transactions in 2022, representing over $600 million in Gross Booking Value.

feed.title: Freightos makes public debut on Nasdaq as SPAC market tanks
feed.summary: Freightos, a digital freight marketplace, went public on the Nasdaq through a SPAC merger, raising $80 million. The company's CEO highlighted the advantages of their SPAC structure, with long-term investor commitments, unlike many SPACs that faced issues with investor pullouts. Despite market volatility, Freightos plans to use the IPO funds to develop technology, expand sales, and marketing to achieve profitability within the next few years.
